result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Cortez Carter

records.addlTxt: Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Van Grunsven.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grayson, Br. 16.

Defendant Kenneth Cortez Carter appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Kenneth Cortez Carter.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Cortez Carter not in court, in custody in HOC.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court in person for Kenneth Cortez Carter.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defense Counsel requests a Preliminary Hearing date. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Cortez Carter not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminar Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD has failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Court order Co defendants keep separate while in custody.

Defendant Kenneth Cortez Carter in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Kenneth Cortez Carter in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kenneth Cortez Carter appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 09. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
